subsections.title: Lodging & Hotels
highlights: 1872 Inn – upscale adults-only lodging
Kelly Inn – family-friendly, close to the park
Explorer Cabins – cozy and well-equipped
Stagecoach Inn, Holiday Inn, and budget motels

subsections.title: Campgrounds & RV Parks
highlights: Madison Campground – NPS-run, 13 miles inside the park
Bakers Hole Campground – forested, north of town, reservable
Grizzly RV Park – full hookups, laundry, showers
Buffalo Crossing RV Park – walking distance to town

subsections.title: Hiking & Running Trails
highlights: Riverside Trail – scenic run/hike along Madison River
Boundary Trail – runs along Yellowstone boundary, good for sunrise runs
Purple Mountain Trail – 6 miles round-trip with views
Lonesomehurst Trail – flat and peaceful forest loop

subsections.title: Snowmobiling & Winter Activities
highlights: Guided and unguided snowmobile rentals available
Old Faithful access via snowmobile in winter (permits required)
Snowcoach tours, cross-country skiing, wildlife tracking
Outfitters: Yellowstone Adventures, Two Top, Backcountry Adventures

subsections.title: Dining, Breweries & Coffee Shops
highlights: Wild West Pizzeria & Saloon – great pizza + beer
Madison Crossing Lounge – upscale mountain dining
Three Bear Restaurant – hearty breakfast
Steam Coffee, Espresso West – local coffee shops
Slippery Otter Pub – local beer and good food

subsections.title: Family-Friendly Activities
highlights: Grizzly & Wolf Discovery Center – wildlife education and live animals
IMAX Theatre – nature films and family shows
Yellowstone Giant Screen – Yellowstone-specific features
Snow play areas in winter, junior ranger activities in summer

subsections.title: Photography Hotspots: Sunrise & Sunset
highlights: Riverside Trail – morning mist along Madison River
Madison Junction – sunrise over open meadows
Duck Creek Road – forest shadows at sunset
Yellowstone boundary pullouts – stars, alpenglow on peaks

subsections.title: Outdoor Gear Rentals & Shops
highlights: Snowmobile and ski rentals: Yellowstone Adventures, Freeheel & Wheel, Gallatin Alpine Sports
Bear spray, boots, and trail gear at Eagle’s Store
Bike rentals available seasonally

subsections.title: Museum & Visitor Centers
highlights: Yellowstone Historic Center Museum – railroad and park gateway history
NPS West Yellowstone Visitor Info Center – maps, ranger talks
Gift shops and interpretation signs in town

subsections.title: Loop Integration & Local Tips
highlights: Ideal base for exploring Yellowstone’s western features
Sunrise park entries and late exits are best for wildlife
Food Roundup and Market Place for groceries
Fuel up before entering park – next gas is 20+ miles in
